intro: Haplopappus junceus, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structure. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Haplopappus junceus is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of ecological changes in its environment.
